name: Long Slow Distance Runs
description: Endurance-building runs at easy, conversational pace. Builds aerobic base and mental resilience. The foundation of any running program.

exercises.name: 30-Minute Easy Run
exercises.description: Entry-level long run at truly easy pace
exercises.instructions: Run 30min at easy, conversational pace. You should be able to speak full sentences. Effort: 60-70% max.

conditions.knee_moderate: Run on soft surface, reduce to 20-25min if needed
conditions.shin_moderate: Avoid concrete, focus on cadence (170-180 steps/min)

exercises.paceGuidance: Conversation test: can you speak full sentences easily? If not, slow down. Many runners run their easy runs too hard.

exercises.name: 45-Minute Easy Run
exercises.description: Standard long run for intermediate runners
exercises.instructions: Run 45min at easy pace. Focus on staying relaxed. Breathing should be comfortable throughout.

conditions.knee_moderate: Monitor discomfort, stay on soft surfaces
conditions.hip_moderate: Focus on hip mobility in warmup, stay on flat terrain

exercises.paceGuidance: This is your 'all day' pace - you could theoretically run at this pace for hours. 60-70% max effort.

exercises.name: 60-Minute Easy Run
exercises.instructions: Run 60min at easy, sustainable pace. This is about time on feet, not speed. Stay aerobic.

conditions.knee_moderate: Break into 2 x 30min with 2min walk in middle
conditions.hamstring_moderate: Thorough warmup, stop if tightness develops

exercises.paceGuidance: Heart rate should stay in Zone 2 (conversational). If you can't talk easily, you're going too hard.

exercises.name: 90-Minute Long Run
exercises.description: Extended endurance builder for advanced runners
exercises.instructions: Run 90min at easy pace. Bring water/nutrition. Focus on relaxed form throughout. This builds serious aerobic base.

conditions.knee_moderate: Only attempt if 60min runs are pain-free
conditions.hip_moderate: Regular walk breaks (1min walk per 15min run)

exercises.paceGuidance: This should feel EASY throughout. The goal is aerobic adaptation, not speed. Many runners fail long runs by starting too fast.

exercises.name: Progression Long Run
exercises.description: Start easy, finish at steady pace - builds endurance and speed
exercises.instructions: 60min total: First 40min easy pace, final 20min gradually build to steady/moderate pace (still aerobic, but noticeably faster).

conditions.hamstring_moderate: Keep progression gradual, don't surge hard

exercises.paceGuidance: First 40min: conversational. Final 20min: build to 'steady' - still sustainable but you feel it. Not a race finish!

exercises.name: Out-and-Back Exploration Run
exercises.description: Mental reset run - explore new routes at easy pace
exercises.instructions: 45-60min easy run exploring a new route. Run out for 20-30min, turn around, return. No watch-watching - just enjoy the run.

modifications.harder: Explore hilly terrain for added challenge

conditions.any_moderate: Stay on known safe terrain if dealing with pain

exercises.paceGuidance: This is about mental refreshment and exploration, not performance. Leave your watch at home if possible. Run by feel.
exercises.mentalBenefit: Breaking routine and exploring new routes has huge mental health benefits. Great for motivation.
